User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Nest Planner application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity (Firebase UID).

role.description: The user's role, which determines the app theme.

householdId.description: The ID of the household this user belongs to.

Household.title: Household
Household.description: Represents a couple's shared household, containing members and a unique code for invitations.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Household entity.

memberIds.description: A list of user UIDs that belong to this household.

Invitation.title: Invitation
Invitation.description: Represents an invitation for a user to join a household.

inviterId.description: The UID of the user who sent the invitation.

inviterName.description: The name of the user who sent the invitation.

inviteeEmail.description: The email of the user being invited.

householdId.description: The ID of the household to join.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category for checklist items within a household.

ChecklistItem.title: ChecklistItem
ChecklistItem.description: Represents an item in the apartment preparation checklist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChecklistItem entity.

name.description: Name of the item to be purchased.

minPrice.description: Minimum estimated price of the item.

maxPrice.description: Maximum estimated price of the item.

isPurchased.description: Indicates whether the item has been purchased.

categoryId.description: The ID of the category this item belongs to.

priority.description: The priority of the checklist item.

ActivityLog.title: Activity Log
ActivityLog.description: Represents a single log entry for an action taken within a household.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed around a shared 'household' model. User profiles are stored in a top-level `/users` collection, with each user document containing a `householdId` to link them to their shared data. All collaborative data (categories, checklist items) is stored in subcollections under a top-level `/households/{householdId}` path. This enforces a clear separation between individual user data and shared household data. Security rules can efficiently grant access to an entire household's data tree by checking if the requesting user's `householdId` (from their profile) matches the `householdId` in the path, enabling secure data sharing between partners. A new top-level `/invitations` collection is added to manage the email-based invitation flow between users.
